questions.question: In which scheduling algorithm does the process switch from the running state to the ready state?
Which of the following is not a state of a process in the process state model?
Which algorithm is used to replace a page when a page fault occurs in virtual memory?
Which scheduling algorithm is based on the process with the smallest estimated run-time to execute next?
The maximum number of processes that can be in the ready state in a system with N CPU cores using Round Robin scheduling is:
Which algorithm allows a process to release a resource before it completes execution?
Which of the following is used to prevent race conditions in operating systems?
What does the Banker's algorithm ensure in resource allocation?
What is the main purpose of a TLB (Translation Lookaside Buffer) in a computer system?

options.A: To store pages that have been swapped out to disk
options.B: To cache recently accessed disk blocks
options.C: To cache recently translated virtual-to-physical address mappings
options.D: To manage virtual memory space allocation

questions.question: Which file system feature is designed to reduce file fragmentation?
What is the primary function of a scheduler in an operating system?

options.C: To control the execution of processes

questions.question: Which technique is used to manage disk space by allocating disk blocks dynamically as files grow?
Which memory management scheme allows processes to be allocated memory wherever it is available?
What is the primary goal of demand paging in virtual memory systems?

options.A: To load all pages into memory before execution
options.B: To ensure every page is loaded into memory at the same time
options.C: To fetch pages into memory only when needed
options.D: To swap out pages from memory preemptively

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a monolithic kernel architecture?

options.B: It allows device drivers to be loaded dynamically
options.C: It separates the kernel into multiple layers
options.D: It combines all operating system functionalities into a single kernel space

questions.question: What is the main advantage of a distributed operating system?
Which of the following is an advantage of using a microkernel architecture?
What is the purpose of the process control block (PCB) in an operating system?

options.A: To store the contents of the CPU registers for a process
options.B: To manage the allocation of system resources to processes
options.C: To maintain a list of free memory blocks
options.D: To handle input/output requests from processes

questions.question: Which of the following scheduling algorithms allows processes to hold onto the CPU until they voluntarily release it?
What is the role of the page table in virtual memory management?

options.A: To store the contents of all pages in main memory
options.B: To translate virtual addresses to physical addresses
options.C: To manage the allocation of pages to processes
options.D: To handle page faults and swap out pages to disk when needed

questions.question: What is the maximum number of processes that can be in the ready state in a system with 4 CPU cores using Round Robin scheduling with a time quantum of 10 milliseconds?
If a counting semaphore is initialized to 5 and there are 3 wait operations and 2 signal operations performed on it, what is the resulting value of the semaphore?
In a preemptive priority scheduling algorithm, if a process with priority 8 arrives in the ready queue while a process with priority 5 is executing, what will happen?

options.A: The process with priority 8 will wait until the process with priority 5 finishes execution
options.B: The process with priority 5 will be preempted, and the process with priority 8 will start execution
options.C: The process with priority 8 will be added to the end of the ready queue
options.D: The scheduler will switch to a non-preemptive scheduling algorithm
